attachmentHtml:
PC Number: 2010-0195

Date: 2010-02-18

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Hugh MacDiarmid, President and Chief Executive Officer, Atomic Energy of Canada Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which remuneration is within the range ($332,800 - $391,500), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(3)(c) of the Bank of Canada Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of W. Paul Jenkins, Deputy Governor, Bank of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which remuneration is within the range ($288,300 - $339,100), effective January 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(3)(c) of the Bank of Canada Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Mark J. Carney, Governor, Bank of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which remuneration is within the range ($411,700 - $484,300), effective January 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act and section 7 of the Crown Corporation General Regulations, 1995, hereby fixes the salary of Charles Chrapko, President and Chief Executive Officer, Blue Water Bridge Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 1 ($116,200 - $136,800), effective September 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 43(1) of the Broadcasting Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Hubert Lacroix, President, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, at the rate set out in the schedule hereto, which rate is within the salary range CEO 7 ($346,800 - $408,100), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 7(1) of the Cape Breton Development Act, hereby fixes the salary of Ross Farquharson McCurdy, former President, Cape Breton Development Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($163,300 - $192,100), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 3.1(2) of the Canadian Commercial Corporation Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Marc Whittingham, President, Canadian Commercial Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($200,700 - $236,200), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(1) of the Canada Council Act, hereby fixes the salary of Robert Sirman, Director, Canada Council for the Arts, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($200,700 - $236,200), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 3(5) of the Canadian Dairy Commission Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of John Core, Chief Executive Officer, Canadian Dairy Commission, as set out in the schedule hereto, which per diem is within the range ($820 - $960), effective August 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Mark B. Laroche, President and Chief Executive Officer, Canada Lands Company Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($209,500 - $246,400), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the remuneration of Victor Rabinovitch, Director, Canadian Museum of Civilization, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($200,700 - $236,200), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 7(2) of the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Karen Kinsley, President, Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 7 ($346,800 - $408,100), effective January 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 8(2) of the Canada Post Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Moya Greene, President, Canada Post Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 8 ($416,200 - $489,700), effective January 1, 2009 and September 9, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 21 (2) of the Canadian Air Transport Security Authority Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Kevin McGarr, Chief Executive Officer, Canadian Air Transport Security Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($200,700 - $236,200), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Ross Nicholls, former President and Chief Executive Officer, Defence Construction (1951) Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($167,300 - $196,900), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Guy Saint-Pierre, President and Chief Executive Officer, Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($224,500 - $264,100), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Guy Saint-Pierre, President and Chief Executive Officer, Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($224,500 - $264,100), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 9(2) of the Export Development Act, hereby fixes the salary of Eric Siegel, President, Export Development Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 6 ($289,000 - $340,100), effective January 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 13(2) of the Business Development Bank of Canada Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Jean-René Halde, President, Business Development Bank of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 6 ($289,000 - $340,100), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Micheline Dubé, Chief Executive Officer, Federal Bridge Corporation Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which remuneration is within the range CEO 3 ($167,300 - $196,900), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Greg Stewart, President, Farm Credit Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($277,200 - $326,100), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 12(1) of the Canadian Film Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of S. Wayne Clarkson, former Executive Director, Telefilm Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($197,800 - $232,700), effective April 1, 2008, and within the range CEO 4 ($200,700 - $236,200), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 6 of the Freshwater Fish Marketing Act, hereby fixes the salary of John Wood, President, Freshwater Fish Marketing Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($145,900 - $171,600), effective May 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 9 of the International Development Research Centre Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of David Malone, President, International Development Research Centre, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($210,300 - $247,400), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Wayne M. Follett, President and Chief Executive Officer, Marine Atlantic Inc., as set out in the schedule hereto, which remuneration is within the range CEO 3 ($167,300 - $196,900), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the remuneration of Joanne V. DiCosimo, Director, Canadian Museum of Nature, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($167,300 - $196,900), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 16(1) of the Royal Canadian Mint Act, hereby fixes the salary of Ian E. Bennett, Master of the Mint, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($277,200 - $326,100), effective January 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(3) of the National Arts Centre Act, hereby fixes the salary of Peter Herrndorf, President, National Arts Centre Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($179,800 - $211,500), effective September 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 7(1) of the National Capital Act, hereby fixes the salary of Marie Lemay, Chief Executive Officer, National Capital Commission, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($209,500 - $246,400), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the remuneration of Pierre Théberge, former Director, National Gallery of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($164,800 - $193,900), effective January 4, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the remuneration of Marc Mayer, Director, National Gallery of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($167,300 - $196,900), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the remuneration of Denise Amyot, Director, National Museum of Science and Technology, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($167,300 - $196,900), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of R. Anthony McGuinness, Chief Executive Officer, Atlantic Pilotage Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 2 ($139,400 - $164,100), effective January 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108 (1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Robert Fernand Lemire, Chief Executive Officer, Great Lakes Pilotage Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 2 ($139,400 - $164,100), effective January 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Réjean Lanteigne, Chief Executive Officer, Laurentian Pilotage Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 2 ($139,400 - $164,100), effective January 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108 (1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Kevin G. Obermeyer, Chief Executive Officer, Pacific Pilotage Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 2 ($139,400 - $164,100), effective January 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Tony Genco, President and Chief Executive Officer, Parc Downsview Park Inc., as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($145,900 - $171,600), effective April 1, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 105 of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of John McBride, Chief Executive Officer, PPP Canada Inc., as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($200,700 - $236,200), effective February 16, 2009.

 

    Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 11 of the Canadian Race Relations Foundation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Ayman Al-Yassini, Executive Director, Canadian Race Relations Foundation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 1 ($116,200 - $136,800), effective April 1, 2009.
